what causes allergies?:
Allergies are caused by the body's immune system overreacting to a harmless substance, such as pollen, dust, or a specific food. When the body comes into contact with this substance, it mistakes it for a harmful invader and produces antibodies to fight it. These antibodies can cause inflammation and other symptoms, leading to an allergic reaction.
